website_summaries.verdict: The Hoka One One Gaviota 2 is a road shoe designed to handle the needs of runners who overpronate. Plenty of users found it to be comfortable and supportive. It did not cause them any pain nor did it aggravate underlying problems. There were users, however, who weren't pleased with the colorways the shoe came in. Nevertheless, the second version of the Hoka One One's Gaviota still proved to be a supportive shoe that allows runners to go the distance.
pros: One runner mentioned that he was able to run in the Hoka One One Gaviota 2 without experiencing any pain
He also felt that his recovery time might lessen because of the shoe's stability features and cushioning
Some testers mentioned how great the shoe felt
Unlike other shoes, it did not aggravate their knee and foot issues
A lot of reviewers appreciated the level of comfort delivered
According to one user, the shoe felt stable during her runs
One female user was happy about how the wide version fit her foot
cons: One male user mentioned that the midfoot section was as tight as the one on the first version
Even though he loosened the laces, the area under the tongue still felt constricted
Some female reviewers weren't happy that there were not enough colorways for the wide version of the Hoka One One Gaviota 2
Almost all female testers commented negatively on the color selection available
It would have been better if there were more vibrant options, they said

customer_reviews.title: Questionable durability.
customer_reviews.text: The shoes overall are very good. They are probably some of the best running shoes ive had in a while. All of this was nice...while it lasted. I run about 3-4 miles daily and the padding was already gone by a month. Foot pain and leg pain immediately came back as a result. On top of that, the shoes are very expensive. If you have the money, get them. However, be aware that the durability is questionable.
customer_reviews.author: Emerson

customer_reviews.title: My 1st pair of Hoka shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes because my podiatrist said the y were well worth buying. I wear a 10.5-11 the shoes I received said 10.5/11. I could barely get my feet in ether shoe. I think they were an 8-9 maybe a 10 & now I have to do what really annoys me paid return or not I have to go to the UPS store & return them. These shoes may be good but I think they should say that perhaps we err on the smaller size & perhaps Customers should order 1 or 2 sizes larger.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Hartley-Snazelle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for you
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are a lifesaver. It wasn’t until now that I did research on what kind of shoes I should wear, being flat footed and all. I looked for shoes with motion control. That’s what supports flat feet and these were in the top 10. I bought them thinking that would be just okay but they were more than that. Having them on is like stepping on clouds but with stability. They look big but they are so light. If you have flat feet, get these. You won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Clever Sangalaza

customer_reviews.title: Hands Down Best Sneaker I have Evah Worn!
customer_reviews.text: I have been battling weight issues for most of my adult life and have very rarely found a sneaker that could both support my weight and allow me to exercise at the same time without ruining the sneakers very quickly, the Hoka One One Gaviota 2 are a pure blessing, thanks you Hoka One One, you have a customer for life!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Not the support I was expecting.
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are comfortable, but much more firm than I expected. For the money, I expected these to be the most comfortable shoes I've ever had. I'm a nurse whom walks about a half mile to and from work most days of the week and spend A LOT of time on my feet for 12 hours during the shift. These are fine to walk in, but I still find that my feet hurt just as bad as they did in my old $50 croc shoes. I'm a little underwhelmed with them.
customer_reviews.author: Cuylor Edgell

customer_reviews.title: Pain-free
customer_reviews.text: I deal with 7 issues of chronic physical pain. This is the only shoe--very literally, the only ones I've ever tried--that sufficiently mitigate much of that pain. For that reason alone, I'd give it 5 stars. The only reason it gets 4 is because the price is really, really high, and the material falls apart rapidly.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best shoes I've ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: So just like my title states these shoes are the best I've ever owned. Over the past few years I've gone through so many shoes trying to find a brand or pair that feels good and works for my job. Most days I would come home with pain in my legs,feet etc. Due to the nature of my job. These have almost completely fixed all of those issue! I'm getting older so some is to be expected but these shoes have been amazing. They're corrective and have really helped a lingering hip issue I've had which has resulted in just so much more pain relief I've had overall. Love them I'll be buying another pair!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will purchase again
customer_reviews.text: For me, literally no break-in period. I did walk with these first, before working out with them. And they wash up great from the Washer.
customer_reviews.author: Steven B

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: These truly provide comfort and stability when power walking. Worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: over rated
customer_reviews.text: This shoe came very well rated by others. Not for me. I finally took out the insole, and, finally enjoyed the walk. $275 is rediculous ! Truly one time only. My Altra Lone Peaks are better in every way and cost less than half, ($119)...the Hoka Walker is over rated, over priced,and , and a one timer .
customer_reviews.author: gary f.

customer_reviews.title: comfort
customer_reviews.text: This shoe was not as comfortable as earlier Hokas I've purchased. Feels like a regular old sneaker. That's not what I paid the big bucks for.
customer_reviews.author: Fisherman

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: get a 1 and 1/2 size bigger if you have meaty feet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Over 100 hrs. research and 10 pairs of top competitors and Hoka wins outright
customer_reviews.text: Actually too much to write about. 6 out of 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: super comfy!! LOVE it!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time to own a pair of Hoka One One, its super light n comfortable. Nice packing. Stylish, n fit my feet perfectly. I m just in love with this brand!
customer_reviews.author: HDK

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Extremely comfortable. Took a few days to break in but I love them now
customer_reviews.author: Gregory C. Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Quality Walking Shoes With Great Support, Comfort & Fit.  Enjoy!
customer_reviews.text: I am retired and try to walk 10,000 steps a day on the walking trails in Colorado. I have been buying these shoes for years and am very happy with the support and comfort they give me while walking. I have a couple bone spurs on both feet and these are the best shoes I have found to keep blisters away and provide the support I need to stay active. I replace these shoes about every 6 months and have 7 sets around the house. I recommend these shoes to family, friends, and others who are looking for a quality workout and walking shoes that provide excellent support and a comfortable fit. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Tom McGee

customer_reviews.title: (Did not purchase through amazon) Not Worth The Money
customer_reviews.text: These shoes I bought at a shoe store in MT, and they were not cheap. At first, I was in love with them at the store, but after using them multiple times now, I am disappointed. My feet ache so bad in these after a couple of hours wearing them, and every time I wear them, they blister me badly (No, they are not the wrong size and I did try many different adjustments to the lacing). I looked at some other reviews on various sites and many people have claimed to have issues with blistering in these shoes, so definitely something to note.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: bottoms peeling off after 6 days
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with how they feel but the bottoms are peeling away after 6 days of light office wear. Huka's warranty covers it, but you have to pay to send them back. Buy them from a place you can easily return from.
customer_reviews.author: CandEproductions

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have athletic shoes that I work out in, and do indoor cardio in, and thought they would be good to begin walking outdoors but they were killing my feet. I looked online and found these Hokas that I had never heard of. I ordered a pair and from day one, they have been like walking on clouds.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Lord

customer_reviews.title: Super plush, well cushioned stability+ running shoe
customer_reviews.text: i started using this when I moved from the New Balance 1200 Series. I am on my 2nd 2 pair purchase. Currently I am moving from a run/walk to a running program. No foot, back pain what so ever.
customer_reviews.author: Suge

product_meta.title: Hoka One One Mens Gaviota 2 Mesh Lead Anthracite Trainers 9.5 UK
product_meta.description: Hoka One One Mens Gaviota 2 Mesh Lead Anthracite Trainers 9.5 UK
feature_bullets: Breathable mesh upper with seamless synthetic overlays
Breathable textile lining for abrasion-free wear
Removable, foam padded insole for cushioning and support
Durable full-length EVA midsole to absorb shock and offer stability
Durable sole with rubber inserts for grip
